CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, December 20, 1952, pg. 13 reads: "Gets Seeing-Eye Dog - Leon Pollard, left, of 2519 Bedford Avenue, is shown taking a walk with his seeing-eye dog, "Beauty," a beautiful German Shepherd, which will be his "eyes" now. Pollard recently returned from New York, where he attended training school in order to learn how to use his "new eyes" and from where he obtained the dog.  He thanks Courier readers, neighbors and Rosey Roswell for helping make his dream come true. Right: Pollard poses with his family, Spencer Moore, co-proprietor of the Pittcon Hotel, Bar and Grill, 1323 Wylie Avenue, and loyal friend, who took a personal interest in Pollard's case, and "Beauty." Left to right, back row: Moore, Pollard, holding "Beauty's" leash; Mrs. Marylyn Pollard, wife, holding the newest member of the family, Ernest Leon, 6-months-old, and Perry, 4, and Terry 6.  Melvin, 8, is standing in front of Moore. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait, left to right: Melvin Pollard, Spencer Moore, Leon Pollard, holding "Beauty's" leash; wife Marylyn Pollard holding Ernest Leon, Perry Pollard, and Terry Pollard, posed in Pollard home
